requirements.requirement_text: "A conformant Plan-Net service **SHALL NOT** require a directory mobile application to send consumer identifying information in order to query content."
"A directory mobile application **SHALL NOT** send consumer identifiable information when querying a Plan-Net service."
"When querying and reading the Plan-Net Profiles defined in this IG, Must Support on any profile data element **SHALL** be interpreted as follows:"
requirements.actor: Health Plan API actors, Application actors

requirements.requirement_text: "Health Plan API actors **SHALL** be capable of populating all Must Support data elements as part of the query results."
requirements.source: Must Support section, Health Plan API Requirements

requirements.requirement_text: "In situations where information on a particular Must Support data element is not present and the minimum cardinality is 0 , the Health Plan API actors **SHALL NOT** include the data elements in the resource instance returned as part of the query results."
requirements.source: Must Support section, Health Plan API Requirements

requirements.requirement_text: "In situations where information on a particular data element is not present and the minimum cardinality is >0 **SHALL** send the reason for the missing information using values (such as nullFlavors) from the value set where they exist or use the dataAbsentReason extension."
requirements.source: Must Support section, Health Plan API Requirements

requirements.requirement_text: "Application actors **SHALL** be capable of processing resource instances containing the Must Support data elements without generating an error or causing the application to fail."
"Application actors **SHOULD** be capable of displaying the data elements for human use or storing the information for other purposes."
"When querying Health Plan API actors, Application actors **SHALL** interpret missing Must Support data elements within resource instances as data not present in the Health Plan API actors system."
"Consumer App actors **SHALL** be able to process resource instances containing Must Support data elements asserting missing information."
"Clients that cache query results can track additions or modifications to directory content through queries that filter content using the _lastUpdated search parameter."
requirements.source: Client Detection of Updates Directory Content section

requirements.requirement_text: "Clients should periodically check that data cached from past queries has not been deleted by querying for the same elements by _id."
requirements.source: Client Detection of Updates Directory Content section

requirements.requirement_text: "It is important for payers to use the Plan-Net profiles consistently in order to achieve true interoperability of directory information among payers."
requirements.source: Representing and Searching Provider Directory Data section

requirements.requirement_text: "The Plan-Net design is based around the following types of searches [General Search, Provider by Name, Organization by Name, Provider by Specialty, Organization by Specialty]."
requirements.source: Representing and Searching Provider Directory Data section, table

requirements.requirement_text: "If no period is provided, then it is assumend the role is active with no expiration date."

"HealthcareServices are typically provided by an organization, except in the case of a Practitioner that is not associated with an organization (see the solo practitioner example), and can be linked to a set of locations where service is provided, or identified as virtual services through an indicated set of virtual modalities."
"All organizations that provide service should define an appropriate set of HealthcareServices to facilitate search."
"The HealthcareService category, specialty and type fields are the highest level of organization of the services provided by the provider's network."
"Practitioners and Organizations indicate participation in a Network with a link to the Network using a PractitionerRole or OrganizationAffiliation instance, respectively."
"PractitionerRole and OrganizationAffiliation instances are what tie Practitioners and Organizations to HealthcareServices, Organizations, Networks and Locations."
"The examples demonstrate the use of the InsurancePlan profile to represent two distinct Qualified Health Plan products covering the state of Connecticut, using a pair of Networks."
"The practitioners and organizations in the examples participate in one or both of these networks."
"Locations can also be used to represent regions using an associated or attached GeoJSON object."
"Practitioner instances provide information about a specific person, including name, gender, languages spoken, and qualifications."
"PractitionerRole defines a role for a particular practitioner, and associates it with locations, specialties, an organization, and networks."

"Organization Affiliation instances describe a role, and link a participating organization that provides or performs the role, with an organization where that role is available, and also links the participating organization to a HealthcareServices and networks."
"OrganizationalAffiliation can also be used to associate a HealthcareService provided by an organization with networks."
"HealthcareService.identifier:NPI SHALL be present if the service has an NPI"
"HealthcareService.providedBy SHALL be present"
"HealthcareService.category SHALL be present"
"HealthcareService.type SHALL be present"
"HealthcareService.specialty SHOULD be present"
"HealthcareService.location SHALL be present"
"HealthcareService.telecom SHALL be present"
"HealthcareService.coverageArea SHOULD be present"
"HealthcareService.availableTime SHOULD be present"
"Location resources SHALL conform to the PlannetLocation profile"
requirements.source: Implicit from the use of PlannetLocation profile for Location resources

requirements.requirement_text: "Organization resources representing networks SHALL conform to the PlannetNetwork profile"
requirements.source: Implicit from the use of PlannetNetwork profile for Organization resources representing networks

requirements.requirement_text: "Each InsurancePlan resource SHALL have a unique id"
requirements.source: Implicit from FHIR resource requirements, observed in example resources like AcmeQHPBronze and AcmeQHPGold

requirements.requirement_text: "Each Location resource SHALL have a unique id"
requirements.source: Implicit from FHIR resource requirements, observed in example resources like CancerClinicLoc, HansSoloClinic, etc.

requirements.requirement_text: "Each Organization resource representing a network SHALL have a unique id"
requirements.source: Implicit from FHIR resource requirements, observed in example resource AcmeofCTPremNet

requirements.requirement_text: "The [HealthCareService] resource may be used to encompass a variety of services covering the entire healthcare spectrum, including promotion, prevention, diagnostics, hospital and ambulatory care, home care, long-term care, and other health-related and community services."
"An InsurancePlan is a discrete package of health insurance coverage benefits that are offered under a particular network type."
"A given payer's products typically differ by network type and/or covered benefits."
"A plan pairs a product's covered benefits with the particular cost sharing structure offered to a consumer."
"A given product may comprise multiple plans (i.e. each plan offers different cost sharing requirements for the same set of covered benefits)."

"InsurancePlan describes a health insurance offering comprised of a list of covered benefits (i.e. the product), costs associated with those benefits (i.e. the plan), and additional information about the offering, such as who it is owned and administered by, a coverage area, contact information, etc."
"A Location is the physical place where healthcare services are provided, practitioners are employed, organizations are based, etc."
"Locations can range in scope from a room in a building to a geographic region/area."
"A network is typically owned by a payer."
"In the PlanNet IG, individuals and organizations are represented as participants in a PLan-Net Network through the practitionerRole and Plan-Net-organizationAffiliation resources, respectively."
"An organization is a formal or informal grouping of people or organizations with a common purpose, such as a company, institution, corporation, community group, or healthcare practice."

"The OrganizationAffiliation resource describes relationships between two or more organizations, including the services one organization provides another, the location(s) where they provide services, the availability of those services, electronic endpoints, and other relevant information."
"Practitioner is a person who is directly or indirectly involved in the provisioning of healthcare."
"This Section describes the expected capabilities of the Plan-Net Server actor which is responsible for providing responses to the queries submitted by the Plan-Net Requestors."
"Systems implementing this capability statement should meet the CMS FInal Rule requirement for provider directory access."
"Plan-Net Clients can use the required capabilities to access necessary data based on their local use cases and other contextual requirements."
"[Plannet_sp_endpoint_organization] Select Endpoints managed by the specified organization"
"[Plannet_sp_healthcareservice_coverage_area] Select services available in a region described by the specified location"
"[Plannet_sp_healthcareservice_organization] Select HealthcareServices provided by the specified organization"
"[Plannet_sp_healthcareservice_endpoint] Select HealthcareServices with the specified endpoint"

"The [HealthCareService] resource may be used to encompass a variety of services covering the entire healthcare spectrum, including promotion, prevention, diagnostics, pharmacy, hospital and ambulatory care, home care, long-term care, and other health-related and community services."
"An InsurancePlan is a discrete package of health insurance coverage benefits that are offered under a particular network type."
"A given payer's products typically differ by network type and/or covered benefits."
"A plan pairs a product's covered benefits with the particular cost sharing structure offered to a consumer."
"A given product may comprise multiple plans (i.e. each plan offers different cost sharing requirements for the same set of covered benefits)."

"InsurancePlan describes a health insurance offering comprised of a list of covered benefits (i.e. the product), costs associated with those benefits (i.e. the plan), and additional information about the offering, such as who it is owned and administered by, a coverage area, contact information, etc."
"A Location is the physical place where healthcare services are provided, practitioners are employed, organizations are based, etc."
"Locations can range in scope from a room in a building to a geographic region/area."
"A network is typically owned by a payer."
"In the PlanNet IG, individuals and organizations are represented as participants in a PLan-Net Network through the practitionerRole and Plan-Net-organizationAffiliation resources, respectively."
"An organization is a formal or informal grouping of people or organizations with a common purpose, such as a company, institution, corporation, community group, or healthcare practice."
"When the contact is a department name, rather than a human (e.g., patient help line), include a blank family and given name, and provide the department name in contact.name.text"

"The OrganizationAffiliation resource describes relationships between two or more organizations, including the services one organization provides another, the location(s) where they provide services, the availability of those services, electronic endpoints, and other relevant information."
"Practitioner is a person who is directly or indirectly involved in the provisioning of healthcare."
"When the provider is a practitioner, there may be a relationship to an organization."
"A provider renders services to patients at a location."
"When the provider is a practitioner, there may also be a relationship to an organization."
"Practitioner participation in healthcare provider insurance networks may be direct or through their role at an organization."
"An extension to describe accessibility options offered by a practitioner or at a location."
"An extension to express a practitioner's spoken proficiency with the language indicated in practitioner.communication."
"An extension representing the days and times a contact point is available"
"An extension describing the service delivery method. If service delivery is virtual, one or more delivery modalities should be specified."
"If service delivery is virtual, one or more delivery modalities should be specified."
"EndpointUseCase is an enumeration of the specific use cases (service descriptions) supported by the endpoint"
"Codes for documenting spoken language proficiency based on the Interagency Language Roundtable scale of abilities to communicate in a language."
"Codes For Organization Affiliation Role"
"A capability that an individual, group, or organization is acknowledged to have in a payer network."
"The state indicating if a qualification is currently valid."
"Categories of virtual service delivery modalities."
"Official URL: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-pdex-plan-net/ImplementationGuide/hl7.fhir.us.davinci-pdex-plan-net"
"Version: 1.1.0"
"Active as of 2022-04-04"
"Computable Name: DaVinciPDEXPlanNet"

"Publication of this data through a standard FHIR-based API will enable third parties to develop applications through which consumers and providers can query the participants in a payer's network that may provide services that address their health care needs."

"The PDEX Payer Network (or Plan-Net) Implementation Guide is based conceptually on the [Validated Healthcare Directory Implementation Guide (VHDir IG)](http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/vhdir/2018Sep/index.html), an international standard."
"The VHDir IG is based on [FHIR Version 4.0](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/index.html)."

"The use of VhDir as the conceptual base for the profiles and extensions in the PDEX Payer Network Implementation Guide is intended to protect implementers of the Plan-Net IG from rework/remapping when the VHDir concept reaches implementation, and becomes a source of data for the PDEX Payer Network."
"[The primary changes from the VHDir IG are to] remove the validation and restriction resources"
"For the purposes of this IG, we consider that problem [how does the client discover the FHIR endpoint of interest] out of scope."
"Provider directories ... [shall] enable[] individuals and consumers to find contact and other accessibility information for individual healthcare providers and/or healthcare organizations"
requirements.source: Background section, Patient/Payer focused bullet point

requirements.requirement_text: "Provider directories ... [shall] enable[] individual healthcare providers, organizations, and payers to discover the relationships between providers, organizations, and payers, as well as additional details about the relationships and entities involved"
requirements.source: Background section, Patient/Payer focused bullet point

requirements.requirement_text: "Provider directories ... [shall] enable[] the electronic exchange of health information by supporting the ability to discover electronic service information including electronic endpoints or electronic addresses"
requirements.source: Background section, Basic Information Exchange bullet point

requirements.requirement_text: "Provider directories ... [shall] enable[] users to find contact and other identifying information about healthcare organizations and individual healthcare providers"
requirements.source: Background section, Basic Information Exchange bullet point

requirements.requirement_text: "A payer publishing a directory of its provider networks through a FHIR endpoint."
"Active as of 2022-03-18"
"Official URL: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-pdex-plan-net/CapabilityStatement/plan-net"
"Version: 1.1.0"
"Computable Name: DavinciPdexPlanNetCapabilityStatement"
"The Plan-Net Server SHALL: Implement the RESTful behavior according to the FHIR specification."
"The Plan-Net Server SHALL: Return the following response classes: (Status 400): invalid parameter"
"The Plan-Net Server SHALL: Return the following response classes: (Status 401/4xx): unauthorized request"
"The Plan-Net Server SHALL: Return the following response classes: (Status 403): insufficient scope"
"The Plan-Net Server SHALL: Return the following response classes: (Status 404): unknown resource"
"The Plan-Net Server SHALL: Return the following response classes: (Status 410): deleted resource."
"The Plan-Net Server SHALL: Support json source formats for all Plan-Net interactions."
"The Plan-Net Server SHALL: Identify the Plan-Net profiles supported as part of the FHIR `meta.profile` attribute for each instance."
"Systems implementing this capability statement should meet the CMS FInal Rule requirement for provider directory access."
"Plan-Net Clients can use the required capabilities to access necessary data based on their local use cases and other contextual requirements."
"Support forward and reverse chaining on all search parameters that specify the 'chain' property"
"Support xml source formats for all Plan-Net interactions."
"See the [General Security Considerations](implementation.html#general-security-considerations) section for requirements and recommendations."
"A server SHALL reject any unauthorized requests by returning an `HTTP 401` unauthorized response code."
"[Endpoint] [Plan-Net Endpoint](StructureDefinition-plannet-Endpoint.html) [Supported Searches:] organization, _id, _lastUpdated [Supported `_includes`:] Endpoint:organization"
requirements.source: RESTful Capabilities by Resource/Profile section, Summary of Search Criteria table

requirements.requirement_text: "[HealthcareService] [Plan-Net HealthcareService](StructureDefinition-plannet-HealthcareService.html) [Supported Searches:] location, coverage-area, organization, endpoint, name, service-category, service-type, specialty, _id, _lastUpdated [Supported `_includes`:] HealthcareService:location, HealthcareService:coverage-area, HealthcareService:organization, HealthcareService:endpoint [Supported `_revincludes`:] PractitionerRole:service, OrganizationAffiliation:service"
requirements.source: RESTful Capabilities by Resource/Profile section, Summary of Search Criteria table

requirements.requirement_text: "[InsurancePlan] [Plan-Net InsurancePlan](StructureDefinition-plannet-InsurancePlan.html) [Supported Searches:] administered-by, owned-by, coverage-area, name, plan-type, identifier, _id, _lastUpdated, type [Supported `_includes`:] InsurancePlan:administered-by, InsurancePlan:owned-by, InsurancePlan:coverage-area"
requirements.source: RESTful Capabilities by Resource/Profile section, Summary of Search Criteria table

requirements.requirement_text: "[Location] [Plan-Net Location](StructureDefinition-plannet-Location.html) [Supported Searches:] partof, organization, endpoint, address-city, address-state, address-postalcode, address, type, _id, _lastUpdated [Supported `_includes`:] Location:endpoint, Location:organization, Location:partof [Supported `_revincludes`:] HealthcareService:location, InsurancePlan:coverage-area, OrganizationAffiliation:location, PractitionerRole:location"
requirements.source: RESTful Capabilities by Resource/Profile section, Summary of Search Criteria table
